name: Oldies: Animals Multiple Choice Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Simon and Garfunkel.

	"At the zoo". ("The elephants are kindly, but they're dumb".)

Three Dog Night.

	"Joy to the World". (Opening line.)

Crosby Stills & Nash.

	"Suite: Judy Blue Eyes". Great song.

questions.text: "The birds in the sky would be sad and lonely".
questions.correct: Billy J. Kramer and the Dakotas
questions.explanation:
Billy J. Kramer and the Dakotas

	"Bad to Me". ("The birds in the sky would be sad and lonely if they knew that I'd lost my one and only ...") (Opening line.)

questions.text: "We grabbed an alligator and we fought another round".
questions.explanation:
Johnny Horton.

	"Battle of New Orleans". ("We fired our cannon till the barrel melted down, then we grabbed an alligator and we fought another round".) They just don't write them like that anymore.

questions.text: "Hey, bird dog, get away from my quail".

questions.explanation:
Lovin Spoonful.

	"Summer in the City". ("Cool cat looking for a kitty, gonna look in every corner of the city"). It's played every time there's a warm summer day.

Debbie Reynolds.

	"Tammy". ("I hear the cottonwoods whispering above ...")

Elton John.

	"Someone Saved My Life". "You're a butterfly ...and butterflies are free ..."

Bobby Darin.

	"Mack, the Knife". Opening line to this classic.
